.. py:function:: pca_line_plot(pca_res, hue, shadow=None, hue_label=None, hue_cmap=None, hue_qualitative=False, shadow_labels = None, shadow_cmap=None, snips=None)

   Draw multicoloured lines, and optionally
   larger "shadow" lines behind them

   :param pca_res: Data to plot the main line
   :param hue: Data according to which to select colour
   :param shadow: Data according to which to select the colours
                  of the shadow
   :param hue_label: Labels to describe different colours of the main line
   :param hue_cmap: A colormap for the main line
   :param hue_qualitative: Whether the colours of the main line are qualitative,
                           by default False
   :param shadow_labels: Labels to describe different colours of the main line
   :param shadow_cmap: A colormap for the main line
   :param snips: Indices indicating which points should *not* be connected;
                 for instance, the end of one trajectory should probably
                 not be connected to the next.

   :returns: * *fig* -- The matplotlib ``Figure`` object used for plotting
             * *ax* -- The matplotlib ``Axes`` object used for plotting
             * *legend* -- The object returned by ``matplotlib.pyplot.legend``
               for the main line
